verses.verse: My son, <WH1121> keep <WH8104> my words, <WH561> and lay up <WH6845> my commandments <WH4687> with <WH854> thee.
Keep <WH8104> my commandments, <WH4687> and live; <WH2421> and my law <WH8451> as the apple <WH380> of thine eye. <WH5869>
Bind <WH7194> them upon <WH5921> thy fingers, <WH676> write <WH3789> them upon <WH5921> the table <WH3871> of thine heart. <WH3820>
Say <WH559> unto wisdom, <WH2451> Thou <WH859> art my sister; <WH269> and call <WH7121> understanding <WH998> thy kinswoman: <WH4129>
That they may keep <WH8104> thee from the strange <WH2114> woman, <WH4480> <WH802> from the stranger <WH4480> <WH5237> which flattereth <WH2505> with her words. <WH561>
For <WH3588> at the window <WH2474> of my house <WH1004> I looked <WH8259> through <WH1157> my casement, <WH822>
And beheld <WH7200> among the simple ones, <WH6612> I discerned <WH995> among the youths, <WH1121> a young man <WH5288> void <WH2638> of understanding, <WH3820>
Passing <WH5674> through the street <WH7784> near <WH681> her corner; <WH6438> and he went <WH6805> the way <WH1870> to her house, <WH1004>
In the twilight, <WH5399> in the evening, <WH6153> <WH3117> in the black <WH380> and dark <WH653> night: <WH3915>
And, behold, <WH2009> there met <WH7125> him a woman <WH802> with the attire <WH7897> of a harlot, <WH2181> and subtle <WH5341> of heart. <WH3820>
(She <WH1931> is loud <WH1993> and stubborn; <WH5637> her feet <WH7272> abide <WH7931> not <WH3808> in her house: <WH1004>
Now <WH6471> is she without, <WH2351> now <WH6471> in the streets, <WH7339> and lieth in wait <WH693> at <WH681> every <WH3605> corner.) <WH6438>
So she caught <WH2388> him, and kissed <WH5401> him, and with an impudent <WH5810> face <WH6440> said <WH559> unto him,
I have peace offerings <WH2077> <WH8002> with <WH5921> me; this day <WH3117> have I paid <WH7999> my vows. <WH5088>
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> came I forth <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> thee, diligently to seek <WH7836> thy face, <WH6440> and I have found <WH4672> thee.
I have decked <WH7234> my bed <WH6210> with coverings of tapestry, <WH4765> with carved <WH2405> works, with fine linen <WH330> of Egypt. <WH4714>
I have perfumed <WH5130> my bed <WH4904> with myrrh, <WH4753> aloes, <WH174> and cinnamon. <WH7076>
Come, <WH1980> let us take our fill <WH7301> of love <WH1730> until <WH5704> the morning: <WH1242> let us solace ourselves <WH5965> with loves. <WH159>
For <WH3588> the goodman <WH376> is not <WH369> at home, <WH1004> he is gone <WH1980> a long <WH4480> <WH7350> journey: <WH1870>
He hath taken <WH3947> a bag <WH6872> of money <WH3701> with <WH3027> him, and will come <WH935> home <WH1004> at the day <WH3117> appointed. <WH3677>
With her much <WH7230> fair speech <WH3948> she caused him to yield, <WH5186> with the flattering <WH2506> of her lips <WH8193> she forced <WH5080> him.

He goeth <WH1980> after <WH310> her straightway, <WH6597> as an ox <WH7794> goeth <WH935> to <WH413> the slaughter, <WH2874> or as a fool <WH191> to <WH413> the correction <WH4148> of the stocks; <WH5914>

Till <WH5704> a dart <WH2671> strike through <WH6398> his liver; <WH3516> as a bird <WH6833> hasteth <WH4116> to <WH413> the snare, <WH6341> and knoweth <WH3045> not <WH3808> that <WH3588> it <WH1931> is for his life. <WH5315>
Hearken <WH8085> unto me now <WH6258> therefore, O ye children, <WH1121> and attend <WH7181> to the words <WH561> of my mouth. <WH6310>
Let not <WH408> thine heart <WH3820> decline <WH7847> to <WH413> her ways, <WH1870> go not astray <WH8582> <WH408> in her paths. <WH5410>
For <WH3588> she hath cast down <WH5307> many <WH7227> wounded: <WH2491> yea, many <WH3605> strong <WH6099> men have been slain <WH2026> by her.
Her house <WH1004> is the way <WH1870> to hell, <WH7585> going down <WH3381> to <WH413> the chambers <WH2315> of death. <WH4194>
